page.title: 02The Farmland.
page.content: The soil is chalk, limestone or clay and crops grown include barley, wheat, sugar-beet, oilseed rape,( recently popular) and potatoes. Many hedges and fences have been removed and few trees now grow in the fields used for crops. Few farm labourers are employed full time because farms are small and modern. Farm machinery such as combine harvesters, tractors and ploughs, sprayers and tillers are used in the fields which are much larger now, so that these machines can be used over large areas without obstacles. The farms are mostly mixed being arable but also having sheep and cattle. The Uffington C of E school children enjoy special visits each year to watch the sheep lambing and later on the sheep shearing and dipping at Croft Farm, near the school, in the village of Uffington.
